metrics.contested election: A national or subnational election occurred in the country that month and was contested. Contested means: results were very close (e.g., margin <3%) OR there were credible, widespread allegations of fraud, vote-rigging, or manipulation.
metrics.crop failure: Reports indicate widespread crop failure or major agricultural losses, often due to drought, pests, disease, or extreme weather, that month in the country.
metrics.economic concern: Significant economic problems reported that month, such as high inflation, rapid currency depreciation, mass unemployment, or severe recession fears.
metrics.military coup: A military coup (successful or attempted, even if failed) occurred that month in the country. Defined as an attempt by armed forces to seize political power from the government.
metrics.political assassination: An assassination (successful killing or attempted killing) of a political leader, official, or candidate took place that month in the country.
metrics.natural disaster: A major natural disaster that month (e.g., earthquake, flood, wildfire, extreme heatwave, drought, tropical cyclone) that disrupted infrastructure, livelihoods, or economic activity.
metrics.ethnic tension: Reports that month indicate widespread ethnic, tribal, or communal tensions or violence. This can include discrimination, clashes, riots, hate speech, or persecution targeting a specific ethnic/tribal/religious community.
